headline: Squash Casserole
description: This easy squash casserole features tender squash, gooey cheese, and crunchy crackers that make this a memorable side dish or a hearty main course.

video.description: Fresh, tender squash combines with Cheddar cheese, sweet onion, and buttery round crackers for an unforgettably delicious bite. Create this silky crowd-pleaser at home with our top-rated recipe and a few tips from Nicole.
video.name: How to Make The Perfect Squash Casserole | Squash, Cheese, Onion, & Butter Crackers | Allrecipes.com

name: Squash Casserole
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup water, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Place squash and onion in a large skillet over medium heat. Pour in water. Cover, and cook until squash is tender, about 5 minutes. Drain well, and place in a large bowl.
Mix cracker crumbs and cheese together in a medium bowl. Stir half of the cracker mixture into the cooked squash and onions.
Mix eggs and milk together in a small bowl, then add to squash mixture.
Stir in 1/4 cup melted butter, and season with salt and pepper. Spread into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cracker mixture, and dot with 2 tablespoons butter.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: My family love it, I have been looking for ways to cook my squash I canned each summer it is a winner. Thanks
LOVE IT ! I swear, this is all I've eaten for 3 days. Delicious and sooooo easy

Great, simple recipe. Thanks so much for posting. However, I deviate with the inclusion of bell pepper, li’l celery, fresh garlic, sour cream, and a tablespoon of Sazonador Total. I also alternate between Keebler Townhouse or Keebler Club Crackers instead of Ritz. But, again, thank you so much.
We always make extra to put into little baking dishes. We put them in the freezer to cook and eat later, and it’s such a treat! We love this dish!
Excellent and easy to make, husband really likes. I add a dash of hot sauce to kick up the flavor.
Absolutely loved this recipe!
I have made this a few times now. I love it and it is always a big hit. My friend asked specifically for this squash casserole for Thanksgiving this year.
Substitute a can of cream of chicken soup for the milk and eggs. Gives it more flavor.

I've been searching for my great Aunts recipe for summer squash casserole. I haven't eaten it for at least 40 years. This was an absolute match for an old Alabama recipe. It satisfied my craving and is on the top of my list. I loved it.
So easy! And oh so good! I used Pepper Jack &cheddar cheese.

My husband and I absolutely loved this casserole. Only change I made was to sauté the squash and onion for a few minutes before I added the water. Then I followed the recipe exactly. Will be making this again.

I was looking for my mom’s squash ingredients and happened upon this one. I made my mother’s and I tried this one because she made it look and sound so good. She was right! Even my mom chose this one over the regular recipe and my mother is a hard sell, trust me! Those in the family who sweared they did not like squash,”loved it.” We are having this for a new side Thanksgiving dish. I want to use someone else’s fingers and give this cheesy squash recipe 4 thumbs up. She is right, it is the best ever! Carthage Mississippi

Made this recipe yesterday. I added about a half a pound of bacon after I fried it out and when I got ready to get my Ritz crackers out I realized I was out of them however I did have a package of whole grain Cheez-Its that I used and it really gave it a great taste. I'll be doing that again.

This came out really good. I did adjust the ingredients a little due to the reviews—-added extra cheese (2 cups); added a lemon pepper seasoning (4 tablespoons) and cooked shrimp (40 small). Overall will definitely make this again.

I made this recipe with squash I bought at my local Farmer’s Market. I added more squash because it’s what I had & I increased the amount of cheese & crackers. This recipe always turns out great & my family loves it.
Used Adobo to account for salt, garlic, oregano recommendations. And also used the pepper and a dash of soul food seasoning.

This is an awesome recipe of pure ingredients, no cream of anything! The only way my husband will eat squash unless it's grilled. Soo good, creamy, cheesy, crunchy! Good for a summer side, cookout, pot luck and comfort food in the winter.
Personally I don't eat it but my wife loves it. Do I am happy to make it for her. Great recipe thx.
Delicious with our squash from our garden!
It's wonderful.. the only change I made was adding Red pepper flakes for some heat. Delicious 😋

This is FABULOUS! I added two extra cups of squash, cajun seasoning, and doubled the cheese and crackers. I cooked it 20 minutes with no topping and then 20 minutes with the topping. This is a delicious way to utilize all the canned summer squash!!!
Absolutely delicious. Nice summer treat and a nice side too for Thanksgiving dinner. Only change next time, I would add a little less salt.
I made it for a Funeral dinner, everyone Loved it!
Oh my goodness! All the loves! I used saltines It was still tremendous. Will make certain I have them for this recipe next time. Made Sunday dinner even more special!
This is the second time that I made this recipe

Nice recipe but can be made much easier...squash, one egg, no milk, butter, oregano and sliced tomato, panko bread crumbs/grated parm cheese on top. No need to precook the squash in water to avoid it becoming mushy. My neighbors love my recipe--all one step!

Perfect without any changes! I have a lot of fresh summer squash from the garden, and this is one of the three "go-to" recipes for variety during the squash overload season. Don't forget to drain the squash/onion mixture before continuing!
My family loves this dish!! So easy to make and a timeless classic!!

Delicious! The first time I made it, I used feta cheese instead of cheddar and it was incredible. I just made it again using cheddar and it is wonderful. I followed the recipe exactly. Love this dish, think I prefer it with feta, it’s tangy.
This recipe is fantastic as is!!

This recipe, as most of your recipes, was easy to make, had ingredients already in my kitchen, can be changed up easily, and this was simply and totally delicious!! My family loves this squash casserole! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
The recipe was easy and quick. The only change I made was using a red onion (my favorite) instead. It’s absolutely delicious. Family favorite.

Loved this so much last week, I’m making it again this week. Added a little more seasoning. The fist time I used garlic butter(because I had some) on the top and this time I sprinkled some garlic salt on the top(because I just had regular butter).

Quick, easy and tasty. A wonderful way to use some extra yellow squash. I used two less crackers than the recipe called for, and I broke the final two teaspoons of butter into small cubes and spread over the top. I ended up using 2/3 C. water, but I had large squash. A yummy treat on a summer day!
I added 1 1/2 cups of cheese, great squash casserole.
Added some mayo and more onions. Very good.
This is the greatest and easiest Squash Casserole recipe there is. After trying many this is my go to recipe.
Love this recipe! I put 3 small zucchini in with yellow squash to stretch and add some color and put extra crackers on top.
Delicious!!
Great recipe. Easy and good flavor. I will add more onion next time and the possibilities are endless. I will definitely add zucchini to this next time.
I did everything exactly....except....I added about 1/4 cup sour cream and about 1/2 cup mayo...I'm wondering if I should have put the egg in though. Guess I will find out soon! 20 minutes left...
It was good. Could taste mostly crackers but with tweaking should be amazing.
Made it exactly as shown except used an 8 x 11 glass baking dish. Delish!! 👍🏽👍🏽

I thought this recipe was pretty good. I made 2 small changes. I sautéed the onions before adding the squash. And I put in a couple of dashes of ground white pepper. I wasn’t sure about using cheddar cheese and about adding the 2 tablespoons of butter on top. I will make it again, but with mozzarella cheese and no additional butter on top.

I made this with frozen yellow squash from my garden. To do this squeeze as much water as possible from squash,( pressed it with a plate then put in a salad spinner). Sauté onions and add squash. Let some water cook from squash.Do Not Add Water. Proceed with the recipe as usual.It turned out as well as fresh.
Delicious
If this is not a go to recipe for Squash Casserole, you may have issues. I’ve made it 2 dozen times.

Growing up in the south, I’ve had more than my fair share of squash casseroles. This recipe was a variation that my family thoroughly enjoyed and it will be my new favorite go-to squash recipe. I added some spice to the squash and onion as I cooked them down, be sure to drain them really really well so you don’t have a lot of extra liquid in your mixture. I probably used more veggies than the recipe called for but I wanted to finish up what I had in the fridge. I didn’t count the crackers but used 1 whole sleeve of Ritz and approx half of another sleeve that was left open by my kids (insert eye roll emoji). I always measure cheese with my heart so I’m sure I used more than a cup. This was so good, I’ll be making it more this summer as we get yellow squash from the garden.
Did as suggested- sauté onions, garlic with squash, used cream instead of milk and one egg.
I love it
This was an easy variation. I like adding the cracker/cheese mix to the filling. I’ll save it!!
I added about another 1/4 cup of cheese on top and included a sprinkle of feta and parmesan.
Easy to make and tastes great!

My job makes a 3 cheese squash casserole for certain holidays. They use corn bread to give it a little extra kick. Instead of the crackers. We have been known to use the buttered crackers in the past though. And garlic powder in both ways. U can also have crumbled bacon add on top. Just an idea from a country restaurant employee.

I also added some zucchini squash I had with it. I Used Club crackers cause that's what had in the pantry. I used extra butter too because I'm from Charleston SC and that's just what we do lol. Also it took longer than 5 minutes in the skillet. I cooked the squash and onions on medium for 15 minutes with minced garlic. I also added a half tsp of dried oregano, half tsp of dried basil, half tsp of dried parsley. I did everything else the same though. Absolutely delicious! So good! Making it again tonight for the 7th time.

Delicious. I sauteed the onions, then combined them with cracker crumbs and cheese. Did not precook the squash. Layered everything in the baking dish, poured the egg & milk mixture, and sprinkled a portion of the cracker crumbs over the top.

I have prepared this recipe 3 times, and it’s a family favorite. The first time I cooked it, I realized (after starting the squash on the stove) that I didn’t have any buttery round crackers, aka Ritz. I didn’t panic but used what I DID have - Cheese Itz. While the recipe isn’t exactly how the author prepares it, mine tuned out so yummy. I made it for my parents and was told, “that’s the best squash casserole we have ever eaten.” Win!
YES, ADDED MORE CRACKERS. WAS EXCELLENT!
I loved this! I did add more ritz crackers to the top than the recipe says. It was so delicious! Will be making this again.
It was perfect. I've been looking for this recipe. Delicious. Thank you
Excellent, yummy and easy. Thanks for sharing!
I used stuffing bread crumbs
I don’t know what it is about this dish but every time I make it, everyone loves it! It’s so simple but always popular!

I made the recipe exactly as stated and it was a huge disappointment. Very bland and as one reviewer stated, “the eggs ruined it, it was a glorified soufflé”. As I ate it I kept thinking of how many calories I was consuming without the reward of the delicious taste I usually require for such consumption. I honestly would have rather eaten it just steamed with a bit of butter and salt and pepper, as is my usual habit. I won’t make it again, but if I did I would use half the eggs or eliminate them completely, reduce the butter (but NOT eliminate it), reduce the milk, and add some additional seasonings - at a minimum. If you like a soufflé-type texture (and are EXPECTING it), then keep the recipe as is with the exception of adding some additional seasonings. I expect that would be quite tasty!

Made this casserole for dinner last night. Being a vegetarian I'm always looking for something new. I doubled the onion, put a bit of sour cream in with the eggs (like someone else said they had done) and used a zucchini from my garden. It was AWESOME! even my partner ate some & he doesn't like veggies!
I added a topping of crushed Ritz crispy thins and cheese the last 10 minutes and baked til cracker crumbs were really brown. Yummy recipe!!

I followed the basic recipe, but because I like more protein, I browned lean hamburger ( you could use pork or turkey ground meat) and cooked the onions with it. Then added that mixture to the squash. Everything else was pretty much the same; tweaked the cheese and butter according to the way the mixture looked. It cooked beautifully in 25 minutes and tasted absolutely delicious.
Really tasty! But I added some chopped fresh jalapeños and some dallops of cream cheese and that MADE it. Will for sure make again when I have too much squash on hand. Thanks!

I love it! 

I used both zucchini and yellow squash, but otherwise prepared the recipe as stated and I LOVED the flavour. It was rich and delicious. I did add a bit more salt, but you really tasted all the ingredients.

I forgot to rate it by the stars the first time., but I'd give it more than 5 if I could! It's a great, quick and easy recipe. I substituted the Ritz crackers for club crackers and it was still wonderful!!!
I did not follow the directions. The squash went into the casserole uncooked. It came out perfect with a nice texture. Not gummy.
It was very good.
It was wonderful! Reminded me of my Grandmother's squash casserole recipes, always loved by everyone in my family!

I change it a bit each time I make it, but I've been making this since Home Economics class, 1963. This time I used hot, spicy Cheeze-Its. Glorious recipe, delicious flavors, easily modified as long as the squash remains the star of this dish.

I absolutely loved this recipe. I gave it four stars because it needed I bit of seasoning or punch at the end. I sprinkled on a bit of Nashville hot seasoning on top and my husband's sprinkled on just a touch of sriracha sauce. I did save some time by cooking the zucchini and onions with water and the butter in my cast iron skillet. I did not feel it needed drained at all so I added some of the crackers to the zucchini and onion and then sprinkled on the rest of the topping and place it directly into my oven. It turned out perfectly and less bowls to deal with. I will definitely make this again.
Excellent way to use up summer squash - I have made this several times. It is simple to make and really yummy. The last time, I did not have the crackers and substituted bread crumbs. Tasted great.

Terrific recipe. I used scallions and saltine crackers and panko breadcrumbs since I didn't have buttery crackers in my pantry. Also used a mixture of shredded cheddar and mozzarella cheese. Results were superb! Will definitely make again.

100% husband approved. Personal Tweaks
Added 1/2 tspn. of garlic powder and a dash of nutmeg. Other than that, I followed the recipe to a T and it was a hit.

Thank you, ROSECART!

This was really good and everyone loved it. I adjusted the recipe a bit because I'm a "lazy" cook. Rather than precook the squash and onion, I just put it in the pan, mixed the other ingredients. It was amazing.
I always make this in individual ramekins that way I freeze it and get out as many as I need or just one for me . It is done all I do is thaw it out and heat up. Very good!
This was not good. It wasn’t awful, but it was just, not good. The cracker crust was dry and made me super thirsty, and the squash seeds made the texture unpleasant. But it was edible.
Delicious. Used whole wheat crackers.
Delicious! I didn’t have ritz crackers so I used oyster crackers and I used a 2T less butter and it turned out great!
I did make some changes only because I cook twice a year and didn’t have all of the ingredients. Lol. I used onion power instead of onion and French onion dip instead of milk. It was so good!

Great recipe. I intend to share it with friends and family. I am not a fan of summer squash, so I am always looking for different recipes. I will definitely make this recipe again. Love the consistency, flavor and easy prep. A hearty dish.

I did make some changes. 

I did not steam the squash and onions for five minutes. I didn't want the squash to be mushy, so I sauteed it in a tablespoon of olive oil, with the onion, adding four medium sized cut up cloves of garlic. 
I did not add the 1/4th cup of butter, because too much butter upsets my stomach. I dotted the casserole with the 2 tblspns of butter, as per the instructions in the recipe.
After pouring the mixture into the baking dish, I added a thickly sliced tomato 
 and sprinkled some parmesan cheese on top.

I loved this! I didn't have a buttery round cracker so I used lite Cheezits. I used skim milk, and Trader Joe's light shredded mexican cheese. So easy to throw together and serve to a crowd. Even those that don't like squash will love this!
This is like heaven in your mouth!! It was easy to make and is delicious!!! Be ready for big cleanup but well worth it!!

Excellent! A great tasting dish with a mild flavor that won’t overshadow the main dish. Easy to liven up with a variety of cheeses and spices. 

If you like one dish dinners, add some other vegetables like zucchini or spinach, or toss in some bacon crumbles if you like. 

The dining world is at your feet with this recipe. I highly recommend.
Easy and quick. I made it with zucchini and added fresh basil.
I only had Trisciuts for crackers and they worked beautifully!
I loved this casserole! Next time I will add some bacon.
I substituted heavy cream for the milk and it turned out wonderful. This recipe is absolutely amazing!!
We liked it very well. Seemed a little bland but next time I will add some herbs!
So quick and easy and always a big hit!!! This dish is truly a family get-together classic!
I followed the recipe almost exactly. I mixed in about 1/4 cup shredded Colby jack just to use it up but still used just the one cup total. It was delicious.

Such a hit! Sautéed the squash in olive oil and cooled it in a colander in the sink to drain. Added garlic salt, oregano, and lots of cracked black pepper. Only used half of the butter. 
Will be a summer go-to for sure.
I added artichoke, a jalapeño, can of corn to the end of the squash sauté to give extra pops of taste in the casserole. Absolutely delicious!
Amazing….and perfect for summer squash.
This casserole is AMAZING!! I made it exactly the way it said (maybe used a couple extra crackers) and it was so yummy. I used fresh squash straight out the garden. I will definitely make this again.
